Senegal

Group H | Africa

Poulet Yassa

With a strong chili and mustard kick enough to have you running as fast as Sadio Mane, this Chicken Yassa is a Senegalese favorite. So much so in fact, that former Senegal striker Papiss Cissé revealed that the best thing Newcastle United did when he joined, was adding it to the club canteen menu.

He also admitted that he can’t cook it. It’s ok Papiss, we’ve got you. We took lead from African Bites and The Wanderlust Kitchen to find a foolproof recipe that would make him proud.

  • Time 2hrs 30mins
    marinate for two hours
  • Makes 4
  • Difficulty Semi-Pro
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 1 Lemon
    1
    1
    Lemon juiced
  • 1 Onion
    1
    1
    Onion sliced
  • 2 cloves Garlic
    2 cloves
    2 cloves
    Garlic minced
  • 1 Chicken stock cube
    1
    1
    Chicken stock cube crumbled
  • 2 tbsp Olive oil
    2 tbsp 1 tbsp
    2 tbsp 1 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 1 tbsp Dijon mustard
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp Cayenne pepper
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Cayenne pepper
  • &frac12; Scotch bonnet
    ½
    ½
    Scotch bonnet deseeded, thinly diced
  • 450g Chicken drumsticks
    1lbs
    450g
    Chicken drumsticks
  • 140g Rice
    1 cup
    140g
    Rice
  • 1 Bay leaf
    1
    1
    Bay leaf
  • 1
    In a large bowl, mix together the lemon juice, onion, garlic, stock cube, 1 tbsp1 tbsp of olive oil, dijon mustard, cayenne-pepper and the scotch bonnet chili. Once combined add the chicken and leave to marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours.
  • 2
    On a high setting, heat the rest of the olive oil in a skillet or frying pan. Once hot, remove the chicken from the marinade (keep the left over marinade) and seal on all sides. This should take around 5 to 10 minutes.
  • 3
    In a small saucepan cook rice in 2 cups500ml of water - bring to a boil, lower the heat and cook with the lid on until rice is soft.
  • 4
    Meanwhile transfer the onion marinade mix to a saucepan set over a medium heat. Cook for around 10 minutes.
  • 5
    Add the chicken, a bay leaf and 1/2 a cup of water to the saucepan. Cover and cook on a medium heat for 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked and the sauce has thickened. Serve over rice with a lemon wedge
